messages.message:
@Serena aihub-validation-udf had a gateway error then timed out twice in a row here: https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/10139/overview/c68b5207-2547-4cad-bc59-bd95b904e224?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1
Sandbox state perhaps, or maybe we should increase the timeout here?
i think there’s something wrong with nginx/crafting since i see errors in the nginx logs around this test run time

actually, that should only be a warning, not an error https://serverfault.com/questions/511789/nginx-client-request-body-is-buffered-to-a-temporary-file

let me take another look

there were a lot of errors (https://crafting-aihub.test.instabase.com/deployment-manager/logs?deployments=api-server&start_time=1716235460000000000&end_time=1716235465000000000) in `api-server` around this time (1:04:22pm PT), which caused the first attempt in this CI run to get a 502 error

then later attempts also called `api-server` in the `beforeEach` hook, and those calls timed out bc of the `api-server` issues mentioned above

i haven’t debugged why `api-server` had so many errors yet

hmm it seems that we got an `invalid file descriptor` error after trying to read a non-existent file path?

it’s expected that sometimes the `extracted_fields.json` file doesn’t exist, so `api-server` shouldn’t crash in this case…

i see that this was previously discussed here as well https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CV8V33RPV/p1701287288854239?thread_ts=1701276164.780159&cid=CV8V33RPV
we’d need someone from the backend side to investigate, this is outside my realm of expertise :sweat_smile:
